author: Hilary Weaver
title: Blue Ivy Was the Real Winner at the Grammy Awards | Vanity Fair

organizations.name: vanity fair blue in pink blue ivy

text: Blue in Pink Blue Ivy Was the Real Winner at the Grammy Awards The pink power suit-clad soon-to-be big sister had a great time on music’s biggest night. by Twitter By Kevin Mazur/Getty Images. Blue Ivy Carter had a front-row seat at the Grammys Sunday night, and the five-year-old made the most of it. She sat with her father, Jay Z , and grandmother, Tina Knowles , while her mother (you know, Beyoncé ) performed and accepted an award. Blue didn’t really sit still, though. She had a night that even her Grammy-award-winning mom might envy. Blue’s ruffle-collared suit, which might be a tribute to the late Prince , was the second little pop of pink in the room. ScHoolboy Q’s daughter Joy (a couple of years Blue’s senior), also made a statement with her tailored choice. Her look was accompanied by what appeared to be this $1,895 Gucci cat purse . Blue’s pink threads helped her stand out, sure, but the ability to insert herself in every frame (and her infectious excitement) made her a true highlight of the night. Beyoncé’s Showstopping Grammy-Awards Style 2000 With Destiny’s Child members Kelly Rowland, Farrah Franklin, and Michelle Williams on the red carpet. Photo: by Kirby Lee/WireImage. 2001 With Destiny’s Child members Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams on the red carpet wearing a dress designed by her mother, Tina Lawson. Photo: by LUCY NICHOLSON/AFP/Getty Images. 2001 Performing with Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams of Destiny’s Child. Photo: by Frank Micelotta/ImageDirect. 2001 Backstage with Destiny’s Child with their Grammys for Best R&B Song and Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal for “Say My Name.” Photo: by Jim Smeal/WireImage. Performing “Take My Hand, Precious Lord,” wearing a Roberto Cavalli gown. Photo: by Kevin Mazur/WireImage. 2015 Backstage wearing a Balmain dress holding her Grammys for Best R&B Song, Best R&B Performance for “Drunk in Love,” as well as Best Surround Sound Album. Photo: By FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP/Getty Images. 2016 Presenting Record of the Year on stage wearing an Inbal Dror gown. Photo: by Kevin Winter/WireImage.
